item.description:
Level 2 open to Sea Kayaks and Rec Kayaks with bulkheads 10ft and above due to potential of wind and waves in this coastal area.

We'll launch at the beach at Fort Foster indicated by sign for windsurfers. See the link below for information and rules of the park.
Fort Foster Information and Park Rules

There is a $10 per car parking fee at Fort Foster so carpooling is encouraged

Fort Foster Beach provides a great launch location fro paddling over to Wood & Whaleback Islands as well as the reefs off of Gerrish Island where seals can be seen sunning themselves. Wind and wave conditions will determine the route we'll take. We may head to the protected waters of Chauncey Creek and stop at the Chauncey Creek dockside restaurant.

Participants in this paddle should have experience as a level 2 kayaker as described on our About Us page Goto the link below to read the kayak skill levels. See the photo above for a view of the area and Launch Site.

NE Seacoast Paddlers Kayaker Skill Levels

Life vests aka PFDs must be worn when paddling with this group

Google Maps directions to Fort Foster Kittery Point Maine


For those who do not want to pay the $10 parking fee at Fort Foster you can launch from Pepperell Cove behind Captain Simeons Galley Restaurant and paddle over to meet everyone. Please arrive 1/2 hour earlier if you plan to do this. There is limited parking at Pepperell Cove boat launch and there is a fee if you park in Captain Simeon's lot.

Directions to Captain Simeons/Pepperell Cove boat launch.
http://maps.google.ca...
item.name: Fort Foster Kittery Point ME Paddle
